summary: 08/10/1999: An unnamed Palestinian motorist ran down Israeli soldiers as they were hitch-hiking at a crossroads near a kibbutz located twenty miles west of Jerusalem, Israel. Six Israeli soldiers were wounded, one of them seriously before the attacker, a motorist, was shot dead by Israeli police.
target1: Israeli Defence Forces (IDF) soldiers hitch-hiking at a crossroads near a kibbutz twenty miles west of Jerusalem
weaptype1_txt: Vehicle (not to include vehicle-borne explosives, i.e., car or truck bombs)
weapdetail: The perpetrator used his car for this attack.
addnotes: The attacker was Palestinian, from Zone A, controlled by the Palestinian Authority. It was the first Palestinian attack inside Israel since Prime Minister Ehud Barak took office in July 1999.
scite1: Six Israeli soldiers wounded in Palestinian attack, attacker shot dead Agence France Press, August 10, 1999.
scite2: Heidi J. Gleit, “7 wounded by terrorist suicide-driver. Settler shot and injured near Mevo Dotan,” The Jerusalem Post, August 11, 1

location: The incident occurred at the Azur intersection, near the city.
summary: 02/14/2001: A Palestinian bus driver, Khalil Abu Elba, steered into a group of young Israeli soldiers and civilians at a crowded bus stop near Tel Aviv, Israel, killing eight people, injuring 17 others. Israeli police shot and captured the perpetrator who fled the scene. Family members of the perpetrator indicated that he was not a member of any militant organization, but Izz-al-Din al-Qassam Battalion, the military wing of HAMAS, said the group was assuming responsibility for the attack.
target1: Soldiers waiting at a bus stop near Tel Aviv
target2: Civilians waiting at a bus stop near Tel Aviv
weaptype1_txt: Vehicle (not to include vehicle-borne explosives, i.e., car or truck bombs)
weapdetail: The perpetrator drove a bus into a crowd of people.
propcomment: The perpetrator crashed into a truck after he was shot and wounded during the police chase.
addnotes: Multiple Palestinian groups, including HAMAS, claimed responsibility for the bus attack, saying it was carried out to avenge the death of Masoud Ayyad, the high-ranking Palestinian security official killed the day before by Israeli Apache helicopters firing antitank missiles.
scite1: Lee Hockstader, “Attack at bus stop kills eight Israelis; Palestinian driver rams into rush hour crowd,” The Washington Post, February 15, 2
scite2: Matthew Kalman, “Bus driver kills eight Israelis. Palestinian acted alone, officials say,” USA Today, February 15, 2
scite3: Hamas armed wing phone caller assumes responsibility for bus attack, BBC Summary of World Broadcasts, February 15, 2001.

location: The incident occurred on Yafo Street.
summary: 07/02/2008: On Wednesday, on Yafo Street in Jerusalem, Israel, an armed assailant drove a front-end loader into civilians, killing four civilians, wounding 45 others, and damaging two buses and two dozen cars. There was no motive reported and Ahrar al-Jalil, Al-Aqsa Martyrs Brigade, and Popular Front for the Liberation of Palestine all claimed separate responsibility.
gname: Ahrar Al-Jalil (Free People of the Galilee)
gname3: Popular Front for the Liberation of Palestine (PFLP)
motive: The specific motive for the attack is unknown.
weaptype1_txt: Vehicle (not to include vehicle-borne explosives, i.e., car or truck bombs)
weapdetail: A front-end loader was used in the attack.
propcomment: The attack caused an unknown amount of property damage to two buses and two dozen cars.
scite1: National Counterterrorism Center, "Four Civilians Killed, Forty-Five Others Wounded in Front-End Loader Attack in Jerusalem, Israel," Worldwide Incidents Tracking System, January 20, 2010
scite2: New York Times,"Palestinian Rams Construction Vehicle into Traffic, Killing Three," Lexisnexis Academic, New York Times, July 03, 2008
scite3: Maan News Agency,"Group Claiming Bulldozer Attack Warns Israel Against Retaliation in East Jerusalem," maannews.net, July 04, 2008.

summary: 03/05/2009: On Thursday, a Palestinian bulldozer driver was shot dead on Begin Highway, in Jerusalem, Israel after ramming a police car with his bulldozer. The two policemen inside the car were slightly hurt in the attack. No claim of responsibility has been reported.
motive: The specific motive for the attack is unknown.
weaptype1_txt: Vehicle (not to include vehicle-borne explosives, i.e., car or truck bombs)
weapdetail: A bulldozer was used in the attack.
propcomment: The attack caused an unknown amount of property damage to a police car.
scite1: Deutsche Presse-Agentur (Germany), "Bulldozer Driver Shot Dead in Jerusalem After Ramming Police," LexisNexis Academic, Deutsche Presse-Agentur (Germany), March 05, 2009.
scite2: National Counterterrorism Center, "Two Police Officers Wounded in Bulldozer Attack in Jerusalem, Israel," Worldwide Incidents Tracking System (December 21, 2009).
scite3: Associated Press Worldstream, "Palestinian Driver Killed After Jerusalem Rampage," LexisNexis Academic, Associated Press Worldstream, March 05, 2009.

location: The incident occurred in the Shmuel HaNavi neighborhood
summary: 08/04/2014: An assailant stole a construction excavator and proceeded to overturn a commuter bus in Shmuel HaNavi neighborhood, Jerusalem city, Jerusalem district, Israel. Two people, an Israeli civilian and the assailant, were killed, while five other individuals were injured during the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Palestinian extremists.
weaptype1_txt: Vehicle (not to include vehicle-borne explosives, i.e., car or truck bombs)
weapdetail: An excavator was used in the attack.
propcomment: A construction excavator and a bus were damaged in this attack.
addnotes: Casualty numbers for this attack conflict across sources. Following GTD protocol, the majority reliable estimates are reported here.
scite1: "1 Israeli killed, 5 hurt as excavator rams Jerusalem bus," Agence France Presse -- English, August 4, 2014.
scite2: "Construction vehicle overturns Jerusalem bus in suspected attack, 2 dead," Reuters, August 4, 2014.
scite3: "Tractor hits bus, killing 1 in Jerusalem terror attack," Jerusalem Post, August 4, 2014.

summary: 11/05/2014: An assailant drove a vehicle into civilians at a light rail stop in Jerusalem city, Jerusalem district, Israel. At least four people, including a police officer and the assailant, were killed and 12 others, including one citizen of the United States (US), were wounded in the attack. Hamas (Islamic Resistance Movement) claimed responsibility and stated that the incident was in retaliation for alleged abuses at Al-Aqsa Mosque.
motive: Hamas (Islamic Resistance Movement) claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that the attack was carried out in retaliation to alleged abuses at Al-Aqsa Mosque.
weaptype2_txt: Vehicle (not to include vehicle-borne explosives, i.e., car or truck bombs)
weapdetail: A metal crowbar and a vehicle were used in the attack.
propcomment: Two vehicles were damaged in this attack.
addnotes: Casualty numbers for this incident conflict across sources. Following GTD protocol, the most recent reliable estimates are reported here.
scite1: "Arab man wounded during November Jerusalem terrorist attack dies," Jerusalem Post, December 8, 2014.
scite2: "Police kill Palestinian after Jerusalem car   attack   wounds 10," Agence France Presse -- English, November 5, 2014.
scite3: "Terror in Jerusalem: Police shoot dead driver who rammed car into light rail station," Jerusalem Post, November 5, 2014.

summary: 10/11/2015: An assailant ran his car into two people at a bus stop and then emerged with a knife near Hadera area, Gan Shmuel town, Haifa district, Israel. Four people were injured either by the car crash or the subsequent stabbing. The assailant was arrested by security forces after the assault. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources named the assailant as Ala Zwid, a Palestinian extremist.

weapdetail: A knife and car were used in the attack.
addnotes: Casualty numbers for this incident conflict across sources. Following GTD protocol, the majority reliable estimates have been reported here.
scite1: "Suspected terror attack: 3 wounded at Kibbutz Gan Shmuel in central Israel," Jerusalem Post, October 11, 2015.
scite2: "Soldier in critical condition after attack near Hadera," Ynet News, October 11, 2015.
scite3: "Three Israelis Hurt in Stabbing Attack in Central Israel; Perpetrator Apprehended by Police," OSC Summary, October 11, 2015.

location: The incident occurred on Malkei Israel street in the Guela neighborhood.
summary: 10/13/2015: An assailant drove his car into a bus stop, exited his car, and began stabbing civilians on Malkei Israel street in Guela neighborhood, Jerusalem city, Israel. One civilian was killed and three others, including the assailant, were wounded in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however sources identified the assailant as Abu Jamal, a Palestinian extremist.
weaptype2_txt: Vehicle (not to include vehicle-borne explosives, i.e., car or truck bombs)
weapdetail: A meat cleaver and car were used in the attack.
addnotes: Casualty numbers for this incident conflict across sources. Following GTD protocol, the lowest reliable estimates are reported here.

scite2: "Three Dead, More Than 20 Injured in Shootings, Stabbings," NBCNews.com, October 13, 2015.
scite3: "At least 21 critically wounded in two simultaneous Jerusalem attacks," Ynet News, October 13, 2015.

location: The incident occurred in the Romema neighborhood.
summary: 12/06/2015: An assailant rammed his vehicle into a civilian, then exited the vehicle and stabbed a police officer in Romema neighborhood, Jerusalem city, Jerusalem district, Israel. The assailant was killed and the civilian and the police officer were both injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources identified the assailant as Omar Eskafi, a Palestinian extremist.

scite3: "2 lightly wounded in Jerusalem vehicular-stabbing attack," JTA, December 6, 2015.

location: The incident occurred along Herzl boulevard, near Chords Bridge.
summary: 12/14/2015: An assailant rammed his vehicle into civilians at a bus stop along Herzl boulevard, Jerusalem city, Jerusalem district, Israel. At least 14 people were injured in the attack. Hamas (Islamic Resistance Movement) claimed responsibility for the incident and identified the assailant as Abed el-Muhsen Hassuna.

location: The incident occurred in the near the Hasira Junction.
summary: 01/27/2018: An assailant drove their car into an Israeli Defense Forces solider near the Hasira Junction, Tel Aviv, Israel. The soldier was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
weaptype1_txt: Vehicle (not to include vehicle-borne explosives, i.e., car or truck bombs)

scite2: "Driver rammed soldier in Herzliya Uzi Baruch ,Today, 9:48 PM," Israel National News, January 27, 2018.

summary: 03/04/2018: An assailant rammed his vehicle into pedestrians near a market in Acre, Northern, Israel. At least three people, including a border police officer and two soldiers, were injured in the attack before the assailant was shot and injured by police personnel. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources identified the assailant as an Arab-Israeli extremist.
motive: The specific motive is unknown; however, sources suspected that the attack had "nationalistic motivations."
weaptype1_txt: Vehicle (not to include vehicle-borne explosives, i.e., car or truck bombs)
propcomment: A traffic light and vehicles were damaged in this attack.
addnotes: There is doubt that this incident meets terrorism-related criteria. Witnesses stated that the assailant became upset after receiving a parking ticket prior to the attack. Casualty numbers conflict across sources. Following GTD protocol, the lowest reliable estimates are reported here.
scite1: "WATCH: Three injured in suspected ramming attack in northern Israel," Jerusalem Post, March 4, 2018.
scite2: "Police: Car-ramming attack in northern Israel injures 3," Associated Press International, March 4, 2018.
scite3: "4 wounded in Acre ramming attack. Witnesses say driver was angry about a parking ticket," The Jerusalem Post, March 5, 2018.
